title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-14.3 - Boiler openings

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-14.3 - Boiler openings

State Regulations
(a) Washout openings. All cast-iron steam and hot water boilers shall be
provided with suitable washout openings to permit the removal of any sediment
that may accumulate therein. Washout openings may be used for return pipe
connections and the washout plug placed in a tee so that the plug is directly
opposite and as close as possible to the opening in the boiler. (b) Threaded
openings. Pipe connections, if threaded, shall be tapped into
material having a minimum thickness as specified in the following table: MINIMUM THICKNESS OF MATERIAL FOR THREADED
